news.heading: E-Commerce Drives Up Demand for Warehouse Space
news.news_snippet: Since switching to strip-till seven years ago, Lance Petersen's farm does all of its own fertilizer application. In 2018, he bought 54 tons of urea online via an e-commerce site. ( Lance Petersen )

news.heading: UPS Cost Pressures Squeeze Gains From E-Commerce Investment Push
news.news_snippet: It’s no secret that the direct-to-consumer market is becoming like the New York City subway system: crowded and filled with people jockeying for position to the closest exit.

news.heading: Local Ecommerce Players Around the World Are Giving Amazon and Walmart a Run for Their Money
news.news_snippet: Sometimes it feels like Amazon is taking over the world—or, at the very least, the world of retail. In providing fast, free shipping, operating from a customer-centric philosophy and swallowing up specialized retailers, Amazon has, by some estimates, put itself on track to capture 49 percent of the U.S. ecommerce market this year.

news.heading: Alibaba vs. Amazon: The Battle Of Disruptive Innovation Beyond Traditional E-Commerce
Farmer Finds Success With E-Commerce; Will Buy All Seed Online
news.news_snippet: Now the 31-year-old leads all the procurement efforts for he and his father’s 800-acre Minnesota farm. And every year, they are buying more and more online and via electronic communication.

news.heading: How 8 Ecommerce Companies Are Competing Against the Old Guard
news.news_snippet: It’s no secret that the direct-to-consumer market is becoming like the New York City subway system: crowded and filled with people jockeying for position to the closest exit.
